wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Hirst Lupton (1836–1905) was an English schoolmaster, cleric and writer.

response: During 1718 he negotiated with leading French churchmen about a projected union of the Gallican and English churches to resist the claims of Rome.Joseph Hirst Lupton, Archbishop Wake and the Project of Union, 1896 In dealing with Nonconformism he was tolerant, and even advocated a revision of the Prayer Book if that would allay the scruples of dissenters.
*Joseph Hirst Lupton, Life of John Colet (1887)
* Joseph Hirst Lupton, formerly sur-master of St Paul's School, in the Dictionary of National Biography.
* 1887 — Joseph Hirst Lupton, "Misrepresentations of Christianity," not publishedMissing in Stephenson 1984, 296; cf. Cambridge Review 9/210 (1887): 49.
* Joseph Hirst Lupton, English schoolmaster, cleric and writer (1836–1905)

In the Dictionary of National Biography article on Robert Pory, by Joseph Hirst Lupton, it is said that Pory, at the time of the first edition in 1663 archdeacon of Middlesex, had his name taken in vain with the claim that he had licensed the almanac.
|Introduction by George Salmon, I and II Esdras by Joseph Hirst Lupton, Tobit by J. M. Fuller, Judith by Charles James Ball, Rest of Esther by Fuller, Wisdom by Frederic William Farrar
* Joseph Hirst Lupton (1836–1905), schoolmaster, cleric and writer, died at Earls Terrace.
He was educated at the City of London School, which was then in Milk Street, Cheapside, whose masters included Joseph Hirst Lupton.
